page.title: 18LOCAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: THIS AREA OF GREAT NATURAL BEAUTY AND GRANDURE HAS SEA,STREAM AND MOUNTAIN.THE BUILDINGS ARE SCATTERED ALONG THE ARC OF THE SHORE.THE MOUNTAIN SIDES ARE WOODED TO ABOUT 1000FT.,WITH STONE WALL DYKES RUNNING UP THE HILLSIDES.ACROSS THE LANDSCAPE RUNS THE SINGLE TRACK ROAD WHICH LINKS THE AREA. SCOTTAS HOUSE IS THE RESTORATION OF A TACK'S MANS HOUSE OF THE 16thC. ALMOST ALL THE OTHER BUILDINGS DATE FROM THE 1880s.THE FEW REMAINING DATE FROM THE 1950s. THE ROW OF BUILDINGS IN THE VILLAGE IS A REPLICA OF A LOWLAND MINERS ROW. THE SHORE IS ROCKY THE ONLY SANDY AREA BEING TO THE EAST. THERE IS A SHEEP FANK AT SCOTTAS. AT CERTAIN PLACES THERE IS EVIDENCE OF QUARRYING FOR LOCAL BUILDING.
